RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo president @dilmabr addresses the sanctioning ceremony of the new Code of Civil Procedure (#CPC): http://t.co/q4cDPB9M...
The sanction of the new Code of Civil Procedure is of great importance to Brazil.
Under legal and technical language, there are changes in lawsuits that directly affect the lives of most Brazilians.
Our new Code of Civil Procedure is born from the search for identity between the social fact and the legal practice, and gives solidity to our democracy.
The new code further democratizes access to justice by extending and facilitating the gratuity or installment of judicial expenses.
More Justice for all in a country that has become more just and less unequal for everyone.
This new Code identifies itself with the demands of a new country, which in the last decades has become more demanding, + aware of its rights
Good justice is fast and effective justice.
Justice loses part of its sense and essence when it is rushed and negligent with the broad right of defense, as well as when it is delayed.
The text arrives in good time, it replaces a code that was + of 40 years, produced during an exception period, and that had been modified.
By oxygenating the legal process, the new code will increase people's trust in justice, strengthening our institutions.
This is the Nation we want to strengthen: a place where everyone exercises their rights without disrespect for civil and public liberties.
A country that, in the face of invitations to adventures and the breakdown of political normality, chooses the path of democracy and constitutional principles.
Yesterday, hundreds of thousands of Brazilians took to the streets to express themselves freely, peacefully and without violence.
Just as the polls translate the will of the nation, which can not be disrespected, the streets are the legitimate space of popular demonstration.
Therefore, the government hears and will continue to hear street demonstrations.
There was a theme present in both the Friday and Sunday demonstrations: the fight against corruption and impunity.
In the coming days, as promised in the elections, we will announce a set of measures aimed at combating corruption and impunity.
We will, of course, be open to listening to the whole society for other measures.
I reiterate my conviction that the current situation points to the urgent need for a comprehensive #Political Reform.
My commitment is to govern for the 203 million Brazilians.

This structure is based on settlement of the agrarian reform, q shows the quality and possibility that a settlement has for Brazil.
This is an experience that worked. We have here the production but also the beneficiation, the bagging ... Soon it will be an industry.
This is Brazil that we want. Family farming based on agrarian reform settlements is a big business for families and the country.
Here we have a high business to put quality food on the table of the Brazilian people.
As it is a business that is starting, the gov. you have to do the part of it. We're already doing our part.
From 2003 to 2014, we had a clear policy of fostering family farming.
We create credit lines; we create agricultural insurance; we support the purchase of equipment; we extend the offer of technical assistance.
I agree with many who say that a great foundation of family farming is the Food Acquisition Program (PAA).
The PAA allowed that there was security for the farmer to produce.
We open public call to buy organic rice to distribute through the PAA. The government is the example.
We are clear about the importance of credit and the financing of public banks to agroindustrialization.
We will allow the family farmers to add value to their production and produce industrializing what they plant or create.
My commitment to #MinhaCasaMinhaVida Rural e / o #Pronatec.
There are 12 million places in #Pronatec. Cooperative settlements have to leave the demand for technical training.
We can put on the breast a medal: social inclusion and overcoming extreme poverty.
This only occurs with social policy of inclusion and income, work and employment, and family agriculture.
We have to take another step, based on the cooperative tripod, agroecology and agroindustrialization.
